methods.name: next?
title: Google

Database
List#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of databases.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

databases = spanner.databases "my-instance"
if databases.next?
  next_databases = databases.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Database
List#all
methods.description:
Retrieves all databases by repeatedly loading #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each database database, which is passed as the parameter.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method may make several API calls until all databases are retrieved. Be sure to use as narrow a search criteria as possible. Please use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each database by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

databases = spanner.databases "my-instance"
databases.all do |database|
  puts database.name
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

databases = spanner.databases "my-instance"
all_database_ids = databases.all.map do |database|
  database.name
end

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

databases = spanner.databases "my-instance"
databases.all(request_limit: 10) do |database|
  puts database.name
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to
make to load all databases. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each database.
